pesticide.PPE: Mixers, Loaders, Applicators and other handlers must wear the following: long sleeve shirt, long pants, shoes plus socks, protective eyewear such as glasses with side shields, chemical resistant gloves made of barrier laminate, butyl rubber ≥14 mils, neoprene rubber ≥14 mils, natural rubber ≥14 mils, polyethylene, polyvinyl chloride ≥14 mils or viton ≥14 mils. Follow manufacturer’s instructions for cleaning or maintaining PPE. If no such instructions for washables exist, use detergent and hot water. Keep and wash PPE separately from other laundry. Discard clothing and other absorbent materials that have been drenched or heavily contaminated with product’s concentrate. Do not reuse them.

Safety_Information.general_Info: Have the product container or label with you when calling a poison control center or doctor, or for going for treatment. Contact INFOTRAC at 1-800-535-5053 for emergency medical information.
Safety_Information.if_In_Eyes: Hold eye open and rinse slowly and gently with water for 15-20 minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present, after the first 5 minutes, then continue rinsing eye. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_Swallowed: Call poison control center or doctor immediately for treatment advice. Have person sip a glass of water if able to swallow. Do not induce vomiting unless told to do so by the poison control center or doctor. Do not give anything by mouth to an unconscious person.
Safety_Information.if_Inhaled: Move person to fresh air. If person is not breathing call 911 or an ambulance, then give artificial respiration, preferably mouth-to-mouth, if possible. Call poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_On_Skin: Take off contaminated clothing. Rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15-20 minutes. Call the poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.physician_Note: Probable mucosal damage may contraindicate the use of gastric lavage.
